content.question: Which of the following describes one factor that led to King Nzinga Mbemba’s statement that “our kingdom was already Christian”?

choices.label: The strength of the Swahili coast garnered the attention of Portuguese Christian missionaries.
The voluntary conversion of the kingdom’s nobility allowed Christianity to achieve wide acceptance.
The European introduction of the griot tradition of disseminated history supported the spread of Christianity.
The access to Trans-Saharan trade routes brought North African traders who introduced Christianity to the region.

content.answer: The voluntary conversion of the kingdom’s nobility allowed Christianity to achieve wide acceptance.
